description: Refactor RoutineEditor to decouple execution visualization from initial load, add an interactive execution history panel, and improve code organization by extracting logic into custom hooks.

tasks.task: Architectural Planning: Design the new component structure and hook interfaces (useRoutineGraph, useRoutineExecution, useAutoSave).
Refactor: Extract auto-save logic into a reusable `useAutoSave` hook.
Refactor: Extract ReactFlow node/edge management into `useRoutineGraph` hook.
Feature: Create `ExecutionHistoryPanel` component to list recent executions with status indicators and timestamps.
Refactor: Extract execution management (running tests, fetching history, selecting active execution) into `useRoutineExecution` hook.
Modification: Update `RoutineEditor` to stop automatically visualizing the latest execution on mount.
Integration: Connect `ExecutionHistoryPanel` to the graph, allowing users to click an execution to visualize its state (overlay node statuses).
UI/UX: Add a 'Live' vs 'History' mode indicator to the editor to clarify when the user is viewing a past run versus editing.
Cleanup: Simplify the main `index.tsx` file by composing the new smaller components and hooks.
UI/UX: Move top bar controls (Mode, Status, Run Test) to floating canvas controls for a cleaner interface.
